CHARACTERS:
1. Captain J.T. Wilder: The story's protagonist. He is the captain of the starship USS Ernest Rutherford. He is a brave and brave and determined leader. He is always looking out for his crew and he will do whatever it takes to save them.

2. First Mate Kevin Jones: Wilder's right-hand man. He is a level-headed and practical man. He is always the voice of reason. He is loyal to Wilder and he will follow him into battle.

3. Ensign Susan smith: The ship's communications officer. She is a bright and bubbly person. She is always upbeat and positive. She is known for her cheerful attitude.

4. Dr. Jake Riley: The ship's medical officer. He is a serious and serious-minded man. He is always the voice of reason. He is known for his calm and collected demeanor.

5. Chief Engineer John Garcia: The ship's chief engineer. He is a hard-working and practical man. He is always the voice of reason. He is known for his no-nonsense attitude.

6. The aliens: A race of unknown creatures that attack Wilder's ship. They are vicious and brutal. They are known for their ferocity.
PLOT:
1.Captain J.T. Wilder of the starship USS Ernest Rutherford is on a five-year mission to explore deep space. 
2.It is a time of great excitement and adventure for the crew as they travel to distant galaxies and make new discoveries. 
3.However, on their latest mission, things take a turn for the worse. 
4.As they enter an unknown region of space, the ship is attacked by a horde of aliens. 
5.The creatures are unlike anything they have ever seen before and they are quickly overrun. 
6.During the course of the battle, Wilder is wounded and taken prisoner by the aliens. 
7.He is taken to their home world, where he is experimented on and subjected to unthinkable torture. 
8.As he suffers at the hands of his captors, Wilder's mind starts to unravel. 
9.He begins to question who he is and what his purpose is. 
10.He wonders if he will ever escape and return to his ship and crew. 
11.Wilder's captors continue to torture and experiment on him, but he does not break. 
12.He remains stubbornly resistant to their attempts to break him. 
13.As he suffers, Wilder starts to have strange visions. 
14.He sees his ship and crew, but they are in different places and different times. 
15.He sees them fighting and dying, but he does not know if they are real or if they are just products of his imagination. 
16.Wilder's captors become frustrated with him and decide to subject him to a final, brutal experiment. 
17.They remove his eyes and insert two strange orbs in their place. 
18.These orbs allow Wilder to see into the past, present, and future. 
19.He sees all the different paths his life could have taken and all the different ways his ship and crew could have died. 
20.He also sees a way to escape. 
21.Wilder finally breaks free from his captors and makes his way back to his ship. 
22.He is driven by a single purpose: to find and rescue his crew. 
23.He knows it will not be easy, but he is willing to do whatever it takes. 
24.He is a changed man, but he is still the same strong and determined leader his crew knows and loves. 
25.He will stop at nothing to save them and he will not rest until they are all safe.

SCENES.SCENE: Captain Wilder is on the bridge of the starship. He is discussing the mission with his first officer, Commander James Smith.
Captain Wilder is in the mess hall of the starship eating dinner with Commander Smith and Lt. Commander Michael Jones, the ship’s second officer.

Captain Wilder is in his quarters on the starship reading a book when he gets a call from Admiral Miller, who commands Star Fleet Command. Miller tells Wilder that there has been an attack on Star Fleet Headquarters by an unknown enemy and that they are now at war with an alien race called the Ssaurians. Miller orders Wilder to take his ship to Mars and join up with other Star Fleet ships there to get ready for battle.

The starship arrives at Mars and joins up with other Star Fleet ships that have also been ordered there by Admiral Miller. The ships are all being commanded by their captains because Admiral Miller has been killed in the attack on Star Fleet Headquarters by the Ssaurians. They await further orders from Admiral M’Benga, who has taken over command of Star Fleet until a new admiral can be appointed by President Henderson of Earth.

Captain Wilder wakes up in a cell on the alien's home planet. He looks around and sees that he is alone in the cell. He looks around for a way to escape but finds none. He tries to get out of the cell but finds it impossible, so he sits down, wondering what they are going to do with him and how they are going to torture him.

One of the aliens opens his cell door and tells him to come with them. They take him down a long hallway and into an elevator that takes them up several floors in the building. They exit the elevator and walk down another long hallway until they reach an area where there are many other cells just like his on both sides of the hall. They open one of these cells, walk inside, and motion for Captain Wilder to follow them inside as well. He does so, wondering what is going on here? Why are all these cells being opened? Captain Wilder regains his senses and gets up off the floor, but then he feels a sharp pain in his back and falls again. He tries again, but this time he crawls on the floor toward the door. He manages to open it by pulling on it with all his strength, but then he loses consciousness again.

SETTING:
-a dark and foreboding alien world
-a world full of strange and dangerous creatures
-a world where the laws of physics are different
-a world where time has no meaning
-a world where mind-control is possible
-a world where torture is commonplace
-a world where technology is far beyond our own
SYNOPSIS: Captain J.T. Wilder of the starship USS Ernest Rutherford is on a five-year mission to explore deep space. It is a time of great excitement and adventure for the crew as they travel to distant galaxies and make new discoveries. However, on their latest mission, things take a turn for the worse. As they enter an unknown region of space, the ship is attacked by a horde of aliens. The creatures are unlike anything they have ever seen before and they are quickly overrun. During the course of the battle, Wilder is wounded and taken prisoner by the aliens. He is taken to their home world, where he is experimented on and subjected to unthinkable torture. As he suffers at the hands of his captors, Wilder's mind starts to unravel. He begins to question who he is and what his purpose is. He wonders if he will ever escape and return to his ship and crew. Wilder's captors continue to torture and experiment on him, but he does not break. He remains stubbornly resistant to their attempts to break him. As he suffers, Wilder starts to have strange visions. He sees his ship and crew, but they are in different places and different times. He sees them fighting and dying, but he does not know if they are real or if they are just products of hisimagination. Wilder's captors become frustrated with him and decide to subject him to a final, brutal experiment. They remove his eyes and insert two strange orbs in their place. These orbs allow Wilder to see into the past, present, and future. He sees all the different paths his life could have taken and all the different ways his ship and crew could have died. He also sees a way to escape. Wilder finally breaks free from his captors and makes his way back to his ship. He is driven by a single purpose: to find and rescue his crew. He knows it will not be easy, but he is willing to do whatever it takes. He is a changed man, but he is still the same strong and determined leader his crew knows and loves. He will stop at nothing to save them and he will not rest until they are all safe.
THEME: The universal truth in this story is that no matter how difficult things get, you should never give up hope. Things may seem hopeless, but there is always a way to persevere.
